fields.name: value
fields.description: The name of the JSON Object key

records.name: NameConfig
records.description: Defines the name of the JSON Object key.

fields.name: allowDataProjection
fields.description:
Allows data projection with specific settings.

This configuration can be either a record or false. 
If it is a record, it contains `nilAsOptionalField` and `absentAsNilableType` options.
If it is set to `false`, data projection is not allowed.

fields.name: skipLines
fields.description: Lines to skip during processing, specified either as an array of integers or a string.

fields.name: enableConstraintValidation
fields.description: If `true`, enables validation of constraints during processing.

fields.name: outputWithHeaders
fields.description: If `true`, when the result is a list it will contain headers as the first row.

fields.name: headerRows
fields.description:
If `0`, all the source data will treat as data rows.
Otherwise specify the header rows(Starts from 1) in the source data.

fields.name: customHeaders
fields.description:
Specify the header names of the source data.
This field will overwrite the header values in the header rows.
This will be mandatory if the header row parameter is larger than one.

records.name: ParseListOptions
records.description: Represents options for treating a list as a record.

fields.name: delimiter
fields.description: The delimiter character used for separating fields in the data.

fields.name: encoding
fields.description: The character encoding of the data.

fields.name: textEnclosure
fields.description: The character used to enclose text fields.

fields.name: lineTerminator
fields.description: The line terminator(s) used in the data.

fields.name: comment
fields.description: The character used to indicate comments in the data.

fields.name: header
fields.description: Specifies whether the header is present and, if so, the number of header lines.

fields.name: customHeadersIfHeadersAbsent
fields.description: Custom headers for the data, if headers are absent.

records.name: ParseOptions
records.description: Represents the options for parsing data.

fields.name: headerOrder
fields.description:
Specify the order of the headers in the source data.
If the expected type is a subset of `record {}[]` this parameter will be ignored.

records.name: TransformOptions
records.description: Represents options for treating a list as a record.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options to be used for filtering in the projection

returnParameters.description: On success, value belonging to the given target type, else returns an `csv:Error` value.

annotations.name: Name
annotations.description: The annotation is used to overwrite the existing record field name.

members.name: CRLF
members.description: Carriage Return and Line Feed (CRLF) line terminator: `\r\n`

members.name: NULL
members.description: Represents a nil value as the string "null".

members.name: EMPTY_STRING
members.description: Represents an empty string as a nil value.

members.name: NIL
members.description: Represents a nil value as Ballerina nil value `()`.

modules.summary: The Ballerina CSV Data Library is a comprehensive toolkit designed to facilitate the handling and manipulation of CSV data within Ballerina applications. It streamlines the process of converting CSV data to native Ballerina data types, enabling developers to work with CSV content seamlessly and efficiently.

modules.description: The Ballerina CSV Data Library is a comprehensive toolkit designed to facilitate the handling and manipulation of CSV data within Ballerina applications. It streamlines the process of converting CSV data to native Ballerina data types, enabling developers to work with CSV content seamlessly and efficiently.
